channel.title: Bloomberg Markets

item.title: China’s Zijin to Buy Kazakhstan Gold Mine for $1.2 Billion
item.description: Zijin Mining Group Co. is set to buy a gold mine in Kazakhstan, underscoring the Chinese company’s ambitious push to expand production of the precious metal.
item.dc:creator: Yihui Xie

item.title: Oil Holds Losses as Risk Premium Recedes Before OPEC+ Decision
item.description: Oil held its biggest weekly loss in more than two years, as hedge funds piled into bearish bets after a fragile truce between Iran and Israel before a likely OPEC+ supply hike.
item.dc:creator: Yongchang Chin

media:content.media:description: Flames burn off at an oil processing facility in Saudi Aramco's oilfield in the Rub' Al-Khali (Empty Quarter) desert in Shaybah, Saudi Arabia, on Tuesday, Oct. 2, 2018. Saudi Aramco aims to become a global refiner and chemical maker, seeking to profit from parts of the oil industry where demand is growing the fastest while also underpinning the kingdom’s economic diversification.

item.title: Stock Futures Rise on Trade Talks, Dollar Weakens: Markets Wrap
item.description: Stock-index futures advanced and Asian equities edged up as progress in several trade negotiations boosted risk appetite.
item.dc:creator: Anand Krishnamoorthy

media:content.media:description: A keyboard on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Wednesday, June 25, 2025. Wall Street’s torrid rebound from April’s meltdown is showing some signs of exhaustion on speculation stocks have run too far amid economic and geopolitical risks. Short-dated Treasuries outperformed.

item.title: South Korea Ends 14-Year Restriction on Kimchi Bond
item.description: South Korea is scrapping a 14-year-old ban on local institutions investing in so-called Kimchi bonds sold for domestic use, in a move aimed at improving foreign exchange liquidity.
item.dc:creator: Haram Lim

item.title: Dealmakers Hit $1.8 Trillion as They Get Used to Trade Chaos
item.description: Big money takeovers of private companies helped drive mergers and acquisitions in the first half, as dealmakers got comfortable writing sizable checks in topsy-turvy markets.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gould, Michelle F Davis, Manuel Baigorri, Dong Cao

item.title: US-UK Auto Tariff Cut Comes Into Effect but No Progress on Steel
item.description: UK car manufacturers can export to the US under a 10% tariff starting Monday, a reduction from the 25% rate imposed by Donald Trump on other countries, as the first elements of an economic agreement between the US president and Prime Minister Keir Starmer come into effect.
item.dc:creator: Alex Wickham

item.title: European Markets Are Becoming Increasingly Difficult to Ignore
item.description: European stocks outperformed their US peers by the biggest margin on record in dollar terms during the first half, the most dramatic sign of how the region’s markets are staging a comeback after more than a decade in the doldrums.
item.dc:creator: Michael Msika, Naomi Tajitsu

item.title: With a Weakening Dollar, It’s America Second
item.description: The new S&P 500 record doesn’t look like one in any other major currency.
item.dc:creator: John Authers

media:content.media:description: Construction for Fourth of July celebrations outside the US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Sunday, June 29, 2025. Senate Majority Leader John Thune is rushing to meet President Donald Trump's July 4 deadline for pushing through his massive tax and spending bill, but first he has to work through a list of approximately.

item.title: Gold Edges Up as Traders Weigh US Trade Deals, Trump Tax Bill
item.description: Gold edged up, supported by a dip in the dollar, as US trade talks progressed ahead of a July 9 deadline and Senate negotiations continued over President Donald Trump’s $4.5 trillion tax cut package.
item.dc:creator: Sybilla Gross

item.title: Singapore Bonds Beat Developed Peers on Liquidity, Scarcity
item.description: Singapore government bonds are trouncing developed-market peers, and the rally may have legs as ample liquidity and limited supply continue to weigh on yields.
item.dc:creator: Marcus Wong, Masaki Kondo

item.title: Stablecoin Frenzy Fuels Steep Stock Gains That Make Funds Wary
item.description: Some investors are growing wary over the global stablecoin craze that has driven massive gains in shares of companies linked to the still-emerging technology.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang, Sangmi Cha

item.title: India’s Bond Index Moment Falters as Foreign Inflows Dry Up
item.description: India’s breakthrough into global debt markets is in need of a second act.
item.dc:creator: Subhadip Sircar

item.title: China Opposes Trade Deals at Its Expense
item.description: With 10 days to go until President Trump's country-specific tariffs are set to resume, China warns the US it will not tolerate trade deals with other countries that go against its interests. Bloomberg's Stephen Engle reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: The Asia Trade 06/30/2025
item.description: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Hong Kong Builder Emperor Shares Drop After It Says Debt Overdue
item.description: Hong Kong developer Emperor International Holdings Ltd. shares fell the most this year Monday after it reported overdue bank loans and said it’s talking to banks on a restructuring plan.
item.dc:creator: Venus Feng

item.title: Canada Drops Digital Tax That Infuriated Trump to Restart Trade Talks
item.description: Canada has withdrawn its digital services tax on technology companies such as Meta Platforms Inc. and Alphabet Inc. in a move to restart trade talks with the US.
item.dc:creator: Melissa Shin, Derek Decloet

item.title: Funds Switch to Selling Korean Bonds After 43-Day Buying Streak
item.description: Overseas investors finally soured on South Korean bonds, trimming holdings after the longest run of inflows in almost two decades, as surging house prices damped bets on central bank interest-rate cuts.
item.dc:creator: Jaehyun Eom

item.title: Medipal Seeks to Diversify to Counter Shrinking Drug Margins
item.description: Japan’s largest drug wholesaler Medipal Holdings Corp. is seeking merger and acquisition opportunities to diversify its business and counter slower growth in the market.
item.dc:creator: Kanoko Matsuyama, Yui Hasebe

item.title: Taiwan Says It Made Constructive Progress in US Trade Talks
item.description: Taiwan said it’s made “constructive progress” in a second round of trade talks with the US, which are aimed at avoiding tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: John Liu

item.title: Global Funds May Shift From Indian Stock Market to China on Improving Sentiment
item.description: Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:
item.dc:creator: Chiranjivi Chakraborty

item.title: China Growth Is on a 'Moderating Trend,' JPMorgan's Ng Says
item.description: China’s factory activity in June improved but still remained in contraction. JPMorgan's Grace Ng says the manufacturing PMI data "is pretty much in line" with what the firm was looking for. She says China "will have growth moderating into the second quarter" given the US tariff policy and other external uncertainties. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: NTT’s $812 Million REIT Float Set to Break Singapore IPO Drought
item.description: Japan’s NTT Ltd. is seeking to raise as much as $812 million in a Singapore listing of its data center real estate investment trust, in what is poised to be the city-state’s biggest IPO in eight years.
item.dc:creator: John Cheng

item.title: Medipal's Yoda on Business Strategy
item.description: Toshihide Yoda, Senior Managing Director at Japan's biggest wholesaler of pharmaceuticals, Medipal, discusses the company's investment and growth strategies as it plans to evaluate cash deployment strategies to ensure better returns to shareholders. He speaks with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade". (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Thai Coconut Water Maker IFBH’s Shares Jump in Hong Kong Debut
item.description: Shares of Thai coconut-water maker IFBH Ltd. rose as much as 67% on their first day of trading in Hong Kong following a HK$1.16 billion ($148 million) initial public offering, the latest sign of renewed vigor in the city’s equity capital market.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Zhu, Kelly Li

media:content.media:description: Photo by Wang Teng/Xinhua via Getty Images Photographer: Xinhua News Agency/Xinhua News Agency

item.title: China’s Scorching Heat Poses Summer Test for Electricity Grid
item.description: A sizzling start to July is on the cards for China, where nationwide temperatures are poised to climb almost 3C above historical averages in the first week of the month.
item.dc:creator: Mary Hui

media:content.media:description: A woman wearing sun protective clothing in Beijing on June 23. Photographer: Wang Zhao/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: China Fund Beats 97% of Peers by Buying Pop Mart, Dumping Moutai
item.description: A 30-year-old Chinese fund manager is trouncing peers this year with a portfolio stocked with Gen Z-favored names like Pop Mart International Group, betting that new-age shopping trends can help his fund overcome the country’s economic sluggishness.
item.dc:creator: April Ma, Mengchen Lu

media:content.media:description: Xie Tianyuan Source: Penghua Fund Management Co.

item.title: Orix to Sell $1.3 Billion Stake in Greenko to Founders
item.description: Orix Corp. will sell most of its stake in Greenko Energy Holdings back to the Indian clean energy producer’s founders for $1.28 billion.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Stapczynski

item.title: Bond Traders Basking in Gains Bet Fed Will Fuel Winning Streak
item.description: US bond traders gutted through turbulence to somehow find themselves notching profits as the first half ends. Now, they’re setting up for more gains following a three-week winning streak, with Thursday’s jobs report as a potential catalyst.
item.dc:creator: Michael Mackenzie, Ye Xie

item.title: Russia Tries Again to Boost LNG Exports Upended by Sanctions
item.description: Russia is taking another crack at expanding exports of liquefied natural gas after US sanctions stalled efforts last year.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Stapczynski

media:content.media:description: Satellite image taken June 25 shows Arctic LNG 2 export's two production trains are flaring. Source: Copernicus

item.title: Bankers Fearing Crisis at New World Sealed $11 Billion Loan Deal
item.description: Nobody wanted to be the banker who tipped Hong Kong’s fragile property market into crisis.
item.dc:creator: Apple Ka Ying Li, Pearl Liu, Trista Xinyi Luo, Shawna Kwan
